data.title: Celebrity Gogglebox 2024 line-up: Meet the famous telly watchers
data.meta_description: All the famous faces appearing in Celebrity Gogglebox 2023, from Davina McCall to Katherine Ryan and Chris Packham.
data.text:
But who else will be leaving audiences in stitches with their TV show commentary?

Read on to find out which celebrities are taking part in this year's Celebrity Gogglebox.

Celebrity Gogglebox 2024 line-up

Danny and Dani Dyer

Father and daughter duo Danny and Dani Dyer are the latest new editions to Celebrity Gogglebox as of 2024.

Many fans will recognise Dani from her time and subsequent win on Love Island. She now has three children and is in a relationship with football player Jarrod Bowen.

Danny Dyer has an eclectic mix of acting credits to his name, including Moff in Human Traffic, Billy the Limpet in Mean Machine and Tommy Johnson in The Football Factory, as well as Mick Carter in EastEnders.

Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely

Best friends Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely are swapping the dance floor for a comfy sofa to watch some telly on as they make their Celebrity Gogglebox debut.

Mel B and daughter Phoenix

Mel B has previously taken part in Celebrity Gogglebox before - however, this time around she is joined by her daughter Phoenix.

The 25-year-old is a social media personality.

Kadeena Cox and Lauren Steadman

Kadeena Cox is also no stranger to Celebrity Gogglebox, but in 2024, she will be joined British Paralympian Lauren Steadman, who has also featured on Strictly Come Dancing and Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins.

Chris McCausland and Donna Preston

Chris McCausland and Donna Preston make their Celebrity Gogglebox debuts this year! Both are known for their work in television and comedy.

Even more celebrities are set to be announced as the season continues.

Returning Celebrity Goggleboxers

Read on for all the famous faces returning to Celebrity Gogglebox in 2024.

Miquita and Andi Oliver

Miquita and Andi Oliver have both appeared in Celebrity Gogglebox since 2021, and have returned every year since.

Clare Balding and Alice Arnold

Broadcaster Clare Balding and her wife Alice Arnold joined the 2021 line-up but did not appear in the 2022 series.

Viewers will recognise Balding from her many presenting gigs, including BBC Sport, Channel 4, BT Sport, and Good Morning Sunday on BBC Radio 2. She is the current president of the Rugby Football League and formerly presented the popular programme.

Jennifer Saunders and Beattie Edmondson

Ab Fab superstar Jennifer Saunders joins the special line-up with daughter and star of sitcoms The Wright Way and Josh, Beattie Edmondson.

Saunders has been married to comedian Ade Edmondson since 1985, and Beattie is one of their three daughters.

Jeff Brazier and Bobby Brazier

Father and son duo Jeff and Bobby Brazier completed last year's line-up of SU2C's star-studded special and they are returning in 2024. TV presenter Jeff had Bobby with his late partner Jade Goody. Bobby recently made his TV debut in EastEnders, and is currently taking part on Strictly Come Dancing with Dianne Buswell.

Zoe Ball and Woody

Zoe Ball and her son Woody have been a part of Celebrity Gogglebox for a few years now and show no sign of slowing down as return to the sofas for another year.

Stephen Mangan and Anita

Actor Stephen Mangan joins the show for season 5 alongside his sister Anita, who works as an illustrator and they are back again 2024.

"Telly and my sister are two of my favourite things so this should be fun," Stephen said.

Chris Packham CBE and Megan

Presenter Chris Packham and his conservationist stepdaughter Megan McCubbin are a part of this year's returning line-up.

On joining the series, Packham, who is best known for his work on series such as Springwatch, said: "Gogglebox is a real barometer of what the nation is talking about. I am looking forward for Megan and I to add our two-bits to the conversation!"

Jane McDonald and Sue

Singer Jane McDonald was joined by her friend Sue for season 5 and they are both returning once again.

Fearne Cotton and Gok Wan

TV presenters Fearne Cotton and Gok Wan made their Celebrity Gogglebox debut together in 2022 and are returning once more in 2024.

Fearne Cotton is best known for hosting shows on BBC Radio 1 and Radio 2, as well as appearances on Top of the Pops, Celebrity Juice and The Xtra Factor.

While Gok Wan rose to fame when he became the host of How To Look Good Naked and his cooking shows Gok Cooks Chinese and Gok's Chinese Takeaway.

Judi Love and Charlene White

Taskmaster's Judi Love returned to Celebrity Gogglebox with her Loose Women co-star Charlene White in 2023 and are back again for another year.

White is best known for hosting ITV News, while Judi Love is a comedian who's appeared on The Wheel, Strictly Come Dancing and Celebrity MasterChef.

Rylan Clark-Neal and Linda Clark

Originally a contestant on The X Factor, Rylan Clark-Neal soon established himself as a TV presenter and media personality after winning Celebrity Big Brother. He has since hosted This Morning, The Xtra Factor, Supermarket Sweep and Ready Steady Cook. He currently appears on Celebrity Gogglebox alongside his mother Linda.

Ellie Simmonds and Richie Anderson

After joining the series back in 2023, the pair are back once more!

Rob Beckett and Tom Allen

The duo we never knew we needed! Beckett and Allen joined the show back in 2022 and have returned once more.

Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash

Stacey Solomon and Joe Swash joined Celebrity Gogglebox back in 2020 and have continued to take part ever since.

Melanie C and Paul

Spice Girl Mel C threw down the mic and cosied up on the sofa, alongside her brother Paul, for a previous series and they will be back once more.

Viewers will be familiar with the singer from her days in the girl group, where she was known as Sporty Spice. She now works as a solo artist, actress, dancer, entrepreneur, television personality and fitness model.

Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aléshé

Comedian Mo Gilligan appeared alongside friend and fellow comedian Babatunde Aleshe on Celebrity Gogglebox.

Gilligan hosts The Lateish Show with Mo Gilligan on Channel 4, as well as The Big Narstie Show alongside the British rapper. Aleshe has appeared in a number of series, including EastEnders, Law & Order: UK, Doctor Who and Waking the Dead.

Shaun Ryder and Bez

The Happy Mondays stars returned to Shaun Ryder's sofa to film another series of Celebrity Gogglebox.

Speaking to RadioTimes.com, Ryder said filming the show with Bez was "really good fun".

"It's not like a job really, it's just me and him. We've been like that for the best part of 40 years – we sat watching telly and films and commentating on everything when we were on the tour bus."

While both enjoy filming together, Bez has revealed that he's found watching some shows more difficult than others. "The most embarrassing one for us is Naked Attraction. That's the most embarrassing one," he said. "Sat there looking at willies, it's not my favourite thing."

Martin and Roman Kemp

Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp and his son, Capital Radio DJ Roman, returned to watch TV together.

Since rising to fame in the new wave band with his brother Gary, Martin has appeared in EastEnders and The Krays, as well as Celebrity Big Brother and BBC music competition Let It Shine. His 27-year-old son Roman has hosted Capital FM's Breakfast Show since 2014 and finished in third place on I'm A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here last year.

Nick and Liv Grimshaw

Radio 1 DJ Grimmy is back on Gogglebox alongside his niece, Liv, who works in fashion. Nick's sister is 11 years older than him, so there is only a 10-year difference between him and Liv - he describes them as more like siblings than uncle and niece, and says the pair are in touch every single day.

Previous Celebrity Goggleboxers

Stephen Graham and Hannah Walters

Boiling Point stars Stephen Graham and Hannah Walters joined the series for the SU2C special with their children Grace and Alfie.

Nicole Scherzinger and Thom Evans

Couple Nicole Scherzinger and Thom Evans joined the special in 2023. Pussycat Doll and former The X Factor judge Scherzinger has been in a relationship with former rugby star Evans since 2019, after they met when he took part on The X Factor Celebrity and Scherzinger was on the judging panel. The got engaged in June this year.

Harry Hill and Tim Vine

Comedians Harry Hill and Tim Vine joined the SU2C special in 2023.

Bob Mortimer and Richard Ayoade

Comedy geniuses Bob Mortimer and Richard Ayoade teamed up for SU2C's special two-parter. Mortimer is famous for his work with Vic Reeves as part of their Vic and Bob comedy double act, and more recently, for his fishing with Paul Whitehouse on BBC Two's much-loved Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing.

Ayoade is known for his roles in the IT Crowd and Garth Marenghi's Dark Place, and his directorial debut Submarine.

Tom Grennan and Martin

Singer-songwriter Tom Grennan was joined by his dad Martin. Grennan found fame as the guest vocalist on Chase & Status's All Goes Wrong in 2016. His debut album, Lighting Matches, was released in July 2018.

Sue Johnston and Ricky Tomlinson

Actress Sue Johnston and her Royle Family co-star Ricky Tomlinson reunited for a previous Gogglebox series. The duo appeared in the BBC comedy from 1998 to 2000, starring as husband and wife Jim and Barbara Royle.

Munroe Bergdorf and Leomie Anderson

Model and activist Munroe Bergdorf was joined by model, designer and TV presenter Leomie Anderson. Bergdorf was the first transgender model in the UK for L'Oréal, and Anderson is the current presenter of BBC Three's Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up star, taking over from Maya Jama.

Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher

Premiership footballers turned pundits Micah and Jamie joined the other armchair critics. Micah played as a right back in the Premier League and English Football League for Manchester City and Aston Villa, and in Serie A for Fiorentina, while Jamie played as a defender for Premier League club Liverpool during his 17-year career.

Denise Van Outen and Duncan James

TV presenter and musicals star Denise Van Outen used to appear on Celebrity Gogglebox with her ex-partner, city trader Eddie, however she was joined by Blue's Duncan James in the most recent series.

Sam Ryder and Scott Mills

Sam Ryder made his Celebrity Gogglebox debut fresh from the Eurovision stage alongside semi-finals commentator and BBC Radio 1 DJ Scott Mills.

The singer-songwriter, who rose to fame after making it big on TikTok, came in second place at Eurovision 2022 with his song Space Man, while Scott Mills is best known for hosting a show on BBC Radio 1 since 1998.

Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey

BAFTA-winner Big Zuu shared the sofa with his Big Eats co-stars Hyder and Tubsey for Celebrity Gogglebox this year.

Big Zuu is best known for hosting Big Zuu's Big Eats, Big Zuu's Breakfast Show and BBC Three's Hungry for It, while his best mates Hyder and Tubsey join him in the kitchen on Big Eats and also host a KISS Fresh show with him.

Oti Mabuse and Bill Bailey

Strictly Come Dancing winners Oti Mabuse and Bill Bailey swapped the ballroom for the living room once again in a previous series of of Celebrity Gogglebox.

Oti Mabuse left Strictly Come Dancing in 2022 and went on to join the judging panel on Dancing on Ice, while Bill Bailey has appeared on This is My House, Travel Man and Worzel Gummidge.

Jamali Maddix and Guz Khan

Stand-up comedian Jamali Maddix teamed up with Man Like Mobeen star Guz Khan for Celebrity Gogglebox 2022.

Jamali Maddix is a regular guest on Sky's reboot of Never Mind the Buzzcocks and has previously appeared on Taskmaster, while Guz Khan has taken on roles in Army of Thieves, The Bubble, Zapped and Our Flag Means Death.

Carol Vorderman and Gyles Brandreth

Gyles Brandreth is no stranger to Celebrity Gogglebox and he previously has been paired with many big names in the past - including Absolutely Fabulous' Joanna Lumley!

Carol Vorderman is best known for her long stint as 'numbers queen' in Countdown. She has done many things since stepping down from the role, including being the regular host of the Pride of Britain awards and took a trip to the jungle in I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!

Charlotte Church and Luke Evans

Charlotte Church shot to fame as a singer in the late '90s when she was a teenager, and her classical album Voice of an Angel sold millions of copies around the world. She later made a move into the world of pop music, hosted her own chat show and more recently has appeared on Charlotte Church's Dream Build, a TV show documenting her renovation of a country house in the Elan Valley in Wales.

She was joined on the sofa by Luke Evans, the Hollywood star best known for roles in the live-action remake of Beauty and the Beast and the film adaptation of The Girl on the Train. He has also appeared in hit TV shows like ITV's The Pembrokeshire Murders and Nine Perfect Strangers.

Mel B and Ruby Wax

As one fifth of the Spice Girls, Mel B (AKA Scary Spice) needs little introduction. Since her girl band days, she has gone on to appear as a judge on The X Factor and America's Got Talent, and also took part in The Masked Singer UK last year, disguised as Seahorse.

Legendary comedian Ruby Wax presented the BBC interview show Ruby Wax Meets... in the '90s, interviewing stars like Madonna, Pamela Anderson and Sarah Ferguson, and is a prominent mental health campaigner.

Tom Daley and Dustin Lance Black

Tom Daley is best known for his successful diving career, which saw him earn four Olympic medals, including a gold at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. He has also appeared as a coach on ITV's short-lived diving show Splash, and earlier this year presented the documentary Tom Daley: Illegal to Be Me for the BBC. Dustin Lance Black won an Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay for the 2008 movie Milk, and has since worked on TV shows like Big Love and Under the Banner of Heaven.

"As big fans of the show, it’s going to be very surreal being on it but we’re very much looking forward to watching what they have in store for us," the couple said ahead of their Gogglebox debut.

Gordon Ramsay and Tilly Ramsay

Chef Gordon Ramsay is, of course, best known as the sweary star of shows like Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares and Hell's Kitchen, while his daughter Tilly has appeared as a presenter on CBBC show Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch. In 2021, she joined the cast of Strictly Come Dancing and was paired with Nikita Kuzmin, eventually leaving the show in Week 9.

"We're always happy to support the superb work that Stand Up To Cancer do, and despite our TV tastes being polar opposites, we had a lot of fun filming this very special episode of Gogglebox," the pair said.

Clara Amfo and Andy

Former Strictly star Clara Amfo used to give her verdict on the latest television shows alongside her brother Andy.

Kadeena Cox and Adam Gemili

Sport cyclist Kadeena Cox and British sprinter Adam Gemili were part of the celeb Gogglebox cast for 2021.

Jonathan Ross and family

TV Presenter Jonathan Ross joined the Celebrity Gogglebox cast in 2021 along with his daughter Honey and her boyfriend.

Martine McCutcheon and James McManus

Actress Martine McCutcheon and her partner James McManus made their Gogglebox debut in July 2021. McCutcheon is the best known for her role as Tiffany Mitchell in EastEnders.

Saoirse-Monica Jackson and Jamie-Lee O'Donnell

The Derry Girls returned to our screens in 2021, with Saoirse-Monica Jackson, who played Erin, and Jamie-Lee O'Donnell, who played (*does best Clare impression*) Michelle, joining the Gogglebox sofa.

Olly Alexander and MNEK

It's A Sin and Years & Years star Olly Alexander appeared in a previous series of Celebrity Gogglebox with musician and hit machine MNEK.

The pair collaborated on Years & Years's hit Valentino, while MNEK helped to produce some of the group's songs such as Play and American Boy.

Joel Dommett and Hannah Cooper

The Masked Dancer host Joel Dommett took Celebrity Gogglebox viewers into his home with wife Hannah Cooper, as the couple joined the line-up for the 2021 series.

Lorraine Kelly and Rosie Smith

Lorraine Kelly made her Celebrity Gogglebox debut in 2021, alongside her daughter Rosie Smith.

Laura Whitmore and Iain Stirling

Showbiz couple Laura Whitmore and Iain Stirling have been together for quite some time and after welcoming their first child, they tied the knot in 2021.

They appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox that same year.

Vic Reeves and Jools Holland

Musician and presenter Jools Holland previously appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox 2020 alongside his friend and comedian Vic Reeves.

Holland is best known for hosting Later...with Jools Holland on BBC2 whilst recording a number of album, while Reeves is one-half of the surrealist comedy duo Vic and Bob (with Bob Mortimer) and co-host of Netflix's The Big Flower Fight.

Anne-Marie and Tom Jones

The Voice UK coaches Anne-Marie and Sir Tom Jones joined the Celebrity Gogglebox cast for 2021.

The show's official Twitter account announced the news as they shared a photo of the duo on the sofa settling down to watch some TV.

Sunetra Sarker and Georgia Taylor

Ackley Bridge's Sunetra Sarker and actress Georgia Taylor previously took part in a series of Celebrity Gogglebox. Sarker is known for her roles as Nisha Batra in Brookside, Anji Mittel in No Angels, Zoe Hanna in Casualty and Kaneez Paracha in Ackley Bridge. She also took part in the 12th series of Strictly Come Dancing back in 2014, and was partnered with Brendan Cole.

Many will recognise Taylor from ITV's Coronation Street where she plays Toyah Battersby. Her other roles included: Ruth Winters in Casualty and Kate Barker in the ITV crime series Law & Order: UK.

Chris Eubank Sr and Chris Eubank Jr

Father and son boxing duo Chris Eubank Sr and Chris Eubank Jr swapped the ring for a few nights on the sofa watching telly back in 2019.

Eammon Holmes and Ruth Langsford

Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langford previously hosted This Morning before departing the day-time programme in 2022.

Martin Compston, Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar

Line of Duty stars Martin Compston (Steve Arnott), Vicky McClure (Kate Fleming) and Adrian Dunbar (Ted Hastings) took a break from filming series six to appear in the Stand Up To Cancer Gogglebox special in 2021.

Aside from the popular BBC One drama, Compston is best known for his roles in The Nest, Victoria and films Mary Queen of Scots and The Aftermath, while McClure has starred in film and TV series This is England, The Replacement and Alex Rider.

John Bishop

Comedian John Bishop previously appeared on the Celebrity Gogglebox sofa. The presenter and comic is best known for hosting The John Bishop Show and appearing in Skins, Who Do You Think You Are? and The Nightly Show.

David Mitchell and Victoria Coren Mitchell

Peep Show's David Mitchell and his wife, Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell previously appeared in a Celebrity Gogglebox special.

David, who's best known as half of the comedy duo Mitchell and Webb with Peep Show co-star Robert Webb, has starred in BBC Two's Upstart Crow and is a team captain on Would I Lie To You?, while Victoria is a TV host and professional poker champion, who's appeared on QI, The Great Sport Relief Bake Off and Hypothetical.

Harry and Sandra Redknapp

Couple goals right here! Football manager Harry has been married to Sandra since 1967 and the happy couple have been together for 57 years after originally meeting at a disco. The pair have two sons together, footballer Jamie and model Mark, and Harry melted the nation's hearts with romantic stories during his stint on I'm A Celebrity.

Susanna Reid and Judge Rinder

Broadcaster Reid presented BBC Breakfast from 2003 until 2014, when she moved to ITV to co-anchor GMB alongside Piers Morgan. Meanwhile, Rinder is best known for hosting courtroom reality show Judge Rinder and Channel 4's The Rob Rinder Verdict.

Nicola Adams and her partner, Ella Baig

Olympic athelte Nicola Adams made it into the record books, winning gold at London 2012 and becoming the first female boxer to become Olympic champion. After blazing a trail for other women in her sport, she was forced to retire from boxing to protect her eyesight. Now she's able to enjoy the fun side of being well-known and often appears on TV, most recently on a celebrity special of The Great British Bake Off. Her girlfriend, Ella is a beauty blogger.

KSI and S-X

YouTuber KSI – real name Olajide Olayinka Williams Olatunji – has been a big name on the streaming site since 2009 due to his gaming-commentary videos. He has since began a boxing career, famously taking on American YouTuber Logan Paul in 2018. His friend S-X – Samuel Andrew Gumbley – is a record producer and songwriter from Wolverhampton, who has worked with Childish Gambino, KSI and Lil Baby.

Jamie Theakston and Ashley Roberts

Heart Radio presenter Jamie Theakston and Ashley Roberts previously appeared together on Celebrity Gogglebox.

Roberts is best known for being a member of pop group The Pussycat Dolls and since competing on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here in 2012 and Strictly Come Dancing, she has developed a successful presenting career in the UK. TV host Jamie Theakston previously presented Top of the Pops and now hosts Heart UK's Breakfast show with Amanda Holden.

Johnny Vegas and Bev Dixon

Benidorm star Johnny Vegas appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox alongside his PA and friend Bev Dixon. Vegas has appeared in BBC comedy Ideal, Still Open All Hours and Good Omens.

Emilia Fox and Joanna David

While Emilia Fox initially appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox alongside her cousin Laurence Fox, in later series she brought her mum Joanna David on the show.

Fox is best known for her roles in The Pianist, Silent Witness, Rebecca and Pride and Prejudice, while her mother, who has been married to fellow actor Edward Fox since 2004, has appeared in Miss Marple, Death in Paradise and Inspector Morse among other titles.

Nigel Havers and Denis Lawson

Actor and presenter Nigel Havers joined fellow actor Denis Lawson on the Celebrity Gogglebox sofa in a previous series.

Havers, who appeared in Coronation Street and Don't Wait Up, also presented The Bidding Room on BBC One, while Lawson, whose nephew is A-lister Ewan McGregor, has starred in New Tricks and the original Star Wars trilogy.
